text: In the darkening recess of an empty lot bordered by a hillside, TWO 20 YEAR-OLDS lounge against a GOLD BENZ. We know them as CHARLIE and OTHER CHARLIE. Charlie tosses a Vietnamese dice in the air - he knows it ‘Bua cua ca cop’ - leaving Other Charlie to guess which animal on the six-sided dice comes up. The game ends as-- An ‘87 Camaro approaches, its heat-inflated tires crackli over gravel. DRIVER’S POV: the young men through the windshield; TWO V MINIATURES in the unseen driver’s palm. He rolls them lik poker player with his chips, contemplating his move. Charlie taps his watch - ‘You’re late’ - as LUDLOW emerges. He removes his sunglasses, twitching, itching, and squint in the setting magenta sun. Bloodshot eyes bleed into bloodshot skin. He looks...like a guy who peaked alongside his ‘87 Camaro
Konnichiwa.
What?
‘Konnichiwa’. Konnichiwa. It means hi. (waves to Other Charlie) Hi. Hi. Hii-- (karate chops the air) --ya! Watch yourself. I had you there. Ludlow dances about: Muhammad Ali on meth.
You guys need any Tina? You partying later? It’s free if you do it with me.
Lower your fucking mouth and open the trunk.
Okay, don’t decide right now. Ludlow begins to open the trunk, then suddenly SLAMS it--
The money!! What about the money? The younger men’s nerves are fraying. Other Charlie lifts his shirt - a STACK tucked into the waistband of his sags
Alright, business first. Check this American sword... Ludlow opens the trunk, revealing a massive 50 CAL. MACHI GUN. They all stare at it.
The fuck is that? We said machine guns...
It is a machine gun. Other Charlie tries to wedge it out of the trunk.
The kind you can carry.
I couldn’t get any of those. But this baby’s from the Vietnam war. She’s got character. Shit - probably even mowed down a few of your relations in its day... Now you can mow down some of mine.
(the machine gun) It’s fucking stuck.
Okay, tell you what. You double this-- Ludlow reaches into Other Charlie’s jeans for the money - his hand SLAPPED away.
Ow. Fuck. Okay, I’m saying you double that - I’1l throw in the car. What do you say? You wanna upgrade?
Nigger I drive a Mercedes fucking Benz. And if I want your faggot-ass ride I’ll take it. Other Charlie stands next to his friend, viciously still.
And Konnichiwa’s not Vietnamese.
Jeez, sorry Charlie. How’m I supposed to tell?
What’s that now? Ludlow finds himself BACKING AWAY from them.
What? I’m just saying it’s confusing. You got eyes like apostrophes, but you dress white, talk black, and drive Jew. (pleading for a laugh) Right? What? Right? They JUMP HIM.
Wait, no, don’t, no, no!! Ludlow takes a terrible beating, FISTS and BOOTS into his face and torso. His KEYS are ripped from his clutch.

Dumb fucking tweak. (one last kick; then) Go, let’s go! BOTH CARS spin out, spraying gravel over Ludlow. He lies still, gasping in the dark. Then, painfully, he sits up. Feels his ear. Blood drainin out. He needs an ambulance. Instead, he gets to his feet...straightens his hair...re- buttons his shirt...and starts walking.

TWO RANCID PROSTITUTES loiter, one of them dressed as a nurse. Ludlow limps past them to a PAYPHONE. Drops in a quarter, dials a number. Outside the booth, th non-nurse approaches the glass. She smiles - showing off mangled teeth - and points lazily to Ludlow’s bloody face
(her friend) She’s a nurse. Ludlow turns away from the bizarre scene as someone pick his call. He simply says:
Where?

Moths rattle inside broken, blinking streetlights. Underneath, it’s HALLOWEEN. COSTUMED CHILDREN run between vietnamese gardens to cramped homes - a patchwork of colo Ludlow stalks through the dark night, crossing down a squ off road. He spots a 10 YEAR-OLD DARTH VADER sitting on a bike. And Darth, not trick-or-treating, spots him. Ludlow CHARGES the young ‘look-out’, scooping him off his bike and scooping a PAGER from the boy’s hands. Ludlow re the pager as the boy kicks him furiously.
(in Vietnamese) Go home. Ludlow looks ahead, stalking further down the DEAD END ST

Ludlow scurries to HIS CAR, parked at the curb of a SHABB HOUSE. In the crumbling driveway, the GOLD BENZ glints. Pulling keys from his pocket with bruised fingers, Ludlow quietly unlocks his trunk. The MACHINE GUN IS GONE, but h pulls back the base mat, revealing a LOW-JACK tracking de We glimpse a few other toys as well: a 9MM, FOUR CLIPS, a KEVLAR VEST... Ludlow looks back down the street - no sign of backup... Looks at his watch... Looks back at the house...
Ludlow follows his 9MM inside. A 16 YEAR-OLD sits frozen, X-Box controller in hand.

(whispers) Where’s she at?  The X-Boxer shakes his head. He may not know, he may not understand, but he’s definitely about to piss himself. Ludlow makes a ‘keep playing’ motion, scoping out a BACK ROOM. He POINTS down the hall, then holds up two fingers: ‘Two of them back there?’ The scared X-Boxer holds up two fingers - as if simply im Ludlow - then two more on his other hand: ‘FOUR of them.’ Ludlow steels himself - that’s more than he bargained for He graciously reopens the front door, allowing the scared scamper out.
Ludlow steps carefully... We hear CHATTER from inside the ROOM. Ludlow opens the door, unnoticed, to find FOUR MEN huddled around his 50. CAL MACHINE GUN like kids at Chris

Charlie. Other Charlies... (ignoring the gun) Where’s she at? The men are taken completely by surprise. But they stay q They’re calculating... Four of them, only one Ludlow... Ludlow FIRES low, kneecapping his pal Charlie. Everybody’ TALKING now - in Vietnamese.
English! Answer me! FIFTH CHARLIE’S POV: through a back screen door, a shakin SLG-SAUER PISTOL steadies on Ludlow. The FIFTH MAN pulls trigger--

BLAM!! Ludlow is SHOT in the back shoulder; he’s thrown violently down the HALLWAY FLOOR. Ludlow cranes back, RETURNING FIRE and dropping the Fifth Charlie. He rolls onto his back, CUTTING DOWN Other Charl when his parking-lot-friend charges. Strangely, no one else emerges. Ludlow lifts himself up, grimacing and gasping for breath. He re-enters

finding only Charlie, MOANING on the floor. TWO MEN MISSI Ludlow listens - his only play - but Charlie’s MOANS drow everything out. Ludlow taps Charlie in the head - BLAM! - concentrates in the quiet... A FAINT SOUND draws him to a CLOSET... Inside, he finds DOOR IN THE FLOOR... Ludlow peers down the dark hole, sha his head. We are way off the page now.

Ludlow drops gingerly into the cave. It’s as if he’s just landed in one of the Viet Cong’s CU CHI TUNNELS. He winds past a CARD TABLE, WEAPONS in a corner, MILITARY DUFFLE B on tables. An EXTENSION CORD leads the way down a JAGGED, WINDING PASSAGEWAY. Ludlow stalks forward... FLEETING SHOUTS ahea His walk breaks to a RUN. He’s rushing in and out of darkness - past AUXILIARY LIGH He’s gaining on the two voices... Then-- A FACE flashes like a train going the other way...he has run past one of the Vietnamese men. He instinctively keep running, as bullets lodge into the clay by his ear. Now Ludlow is caught in between - reloading as he takes f from AHEAD and BEHIND. He’s RETURNING FIRE in both in directions when everything comes to a grinding halt... Ludlow stands before a CAGE on the ground. TWO VIETNAMESE GIRLS, 12 and 14, stare at him through wir bars in fear-induced wonderment. Ludlow looks ahead - letting his prey go (we HEAR the footsteps fade away) - then behind: the footsteps grow LO until the pursuing thug appears... POP! POP! POP! He snap backward as Ludlow pumps three in his chest. Ludlow walks sullenly back; he drags the body away from t cage. Ludlow kneels down, eye-to-eye with the cowering gi

It’s okay... I’m-- I’m not them. Words, even gestures, are lost on the children. Exhausted Ludlow simply slumps down beside them. He pulls at the bullet-proof vest chafing his neck... The girls have stop erying. They know he won’t hurt them. And this - to a point - breaks Ludlow down.

+..now the world rolls. A POLICE HELICOPTER shines it’s belly light on the neighborhood below. Higher up, in less rarified air, NEWS HELICOPTERS jockey for position. On the ground, POLICE CARS everywhere. Pockets of ONLOOKE painted in the flashing red and blue lights. In the purgatory between onlookers and the scene, an attractive FEMALE REPORTER, 30’s, waits with her Channel CAMERAMAN. She looks the part: hair, makeup, get-up - but there’s a natural beauty beneath. At the moment, she’s transfixed by Ludlow. He’s standing a window - inside the dealers’ house - answering TWO MEN.
It’s Wander. MEGAN turns to find LIEUTENANT TERRY WANDER (50’s, tall - a little dashing) cutting through the fray towards the sc She scurries next to him--
Lieutenant, anything you can tell us? Or tell me? We were here twenty minutes before the rest--
(calmly) Hi Megan.
Hi. (then) Just a few words? On camera?
What are you thinking so far?
L.A. cops take down sex ring.
Anything on systems, teamwork?
A coordinated effort, months of planning--
Alright, hang around after.
Thank you, Lieutenant. Wander heads up shabby steps into the house. He cranes ba
Trade.
What?
Sex trade. Sex ring sounds hinky.
Ludlow sits despondently - yet undiminished - beneath TWO DETECTIVES. DeMILLE is 38, white and running to fat. SHON 36, black and slender. They work the system hard and fast
What were you doing here Ludlow?
What?
You wanna work vice now? Ludlow is clearly out of his element now, in the aftermat

I followed the guns to the girl. Ludlow watches a STRING of PLAIN-CLOTHED DETECTIVES carry the MILITARY DUFFLE BAGS out the back door. He locks eyes with a PIGGISH SERGEANT (CLADY, 50's), directing traffic. Something not quite right here.
(to Ludlow) What’s the matter, you need a bracer? That liquid courage wearing off?
We had six months into this case, Ludlow. Could’ve at least given us a call.
Motherfuckin glory hound. That’s all he is. Ludlow looks at them for the first time.
(softly) What were you doing for six months?
Fuck you Ludlow!
(calling off his dogs) Hey! Cool it. Clady’s eyes are on Wander, gliding through the front doo The Nightwatch Commander assesses the carnage.
(grandiosely) Make me redundant, gentlemen. (then) Clady, where’s my boy? The stocky sergeant, Wander’s ‘second’, points him to Lud
There he is. (to Ludlow) They reading you the riot act?
Just a few softballs.
(to Ludlow) Why’re you sitting? You hurt? Ludlow rises awkwardly as Wander looks beyond the men: Ot Charlie lies on the floor, his chest subtly rising.
(casually) Jesus, this one’s still breathing. (to an aid) Get a medic in here. Wander looks exasperatedly at the three men. DeMille gets his pad and pencil out again.
You call an ambulance Ludlow?
No, that’s what I need you for.  10.
(peacekeeping) Alright, you got what you need fellas?
Sure boss. Wander takes Ludlow under his wing, leading him away. An crew brushes past, to Other Charlie on the ground.
You might wanna check for a blood clot. Something about ‘blood clot’ sets Ludlow off.
What’d you say? Wander gets a firm grip on Ludlow’s arm, but says nothing
(playing dumb) What’d I say? Ludlow holds his temper, easing away.
Wander takes Ludlow aside, his aides hanging politely bac
(publicly) Alright... (privately) You okay? Wander’s checking more than Ludlow’s emotional state.
Look at me. You did good and you’re in my show now, so relax. Ludlow nods at Wander - obviously a shared past between t

Alright, they’re gonna separate you; I’m having Ridley meet you at the station right now - let him take your statement; and-- (searching) --Oh, forensics is towing your car. Ludlow winces, eyes on the floor.  ll.
Better you don’t drive anyway... Adrenaline and all that.
I’m fine.
I know you are. Heads up though. (eye contact) Megan’s outside.
So?
So take a mint. One of Wander’s aides hands him a MINER’S LIGHT. A CREW readies to descend into the TUNNEL--
(to all; rousingly) Alright, who’s coming with me boys?

A UNIFORMED BLACK OFFICER (Mody, 40’s) drapes a blanket o the teen X-BOXER’S shoulders. He watches a THIRD BODY bei removed from the house...followed by Ludlow. In the black officer’s eyes - sheer contempt.
You slowing down, Ludlow? Ludlow stops, tries to comprehend the intrusion.
(the bodies) Just three tonight? Ludlow SEES the X-Boxer sitting beneath Mody.
You taking statements now Mody?
I’m community interface for the victims’ family members.
Has he given his statement?  12. Mody stands stubbornly over the boy.
(to the X-Boxer) c’mere. No, keep your blanket and c’mere. Ludlow motions a fellow detective over, handing the boy o
(to Mody) You’re on the wrong side of the yellow tape, aren’t you?
I’m right where I belong.
Mody, give out all the blankets and lollypops you want, just wait ‘til the real police work’s done. Okay pumpkin?
I know how it works Ludlow.
Well you ever need reminding - I’d be happy... Mody stares hatefully as ANOTHER BODY is carted out. Ludl SEES it, turns back to Mody and ever so subtly... shrugs.
The ‘87 Camaro is hoisted awkwardly by a tow truck. Ludlo watches, pained. WOMAN ’S VOICE (sarcastically) That's not good for it. Ludlow turns to find Megan approaching. She smiles pretti
Miss me? You know sometimes I think you do these shoot’em-ups just so you can see me. Ludlow stares at the CAMERAMAN trailing Megan. He makes a ‘scamper off’ motion with his hand--
Go ‘way. The Cameraman knows Ludlow. He’s gone.  13.
Just a few words-- (beating him to the punch) --besides ‘fuck off’.
(dismissively) You gonna pick me up later?
c’mon, your Lieutenant’s giving me something.
I’m sure he is. Megan finally notices, Ludlow’s subtly swaying.
Jesus, are you alright? You’re fucking shaking. Ludlow looks at her squarely, willing himself still.
Uncross your arms. DRIVER’S VOICE (car door) It’s open Ludlow.
(mock scorn) I really don’t like you this way.
I know. You like me better when I’m whoring for a story. Ludlow settles gingerly in the passenger seat.
So? What happened in there?
It’s just a blur. She considers Ludlow a moment. Then, coyly--
Well, that’s too bad.  14.
(warming) Yeah, why?
Because I really wanted a quote. And... Ludlow seems to dare Megan to say it - whatever it is - in front of his listening driver.
Well it’s not going to lick itself, now is it, Lud? Ludlow grins...his kind of woman...as he rolls away.
Ludlow interrupts a RECEPTIONIST with her magazine.
I’m Tom Ludlow. I’m heading in if they’re ready.
(disinterested) Ready for what?
I shot some human beings tonight.
That was you? (he walks on) You know where you’re going? Down the hall--

(sullenly) I know the way, honey. INT. DEPOSITION ROOM, DISTRIC ATTORNEY’S OFFICE - NIGHT TWO COPS (one of them RIDLEY) and a FEMALE DISTRICT ATTOR Make up the ‘shooting team.’ They’re going through the mo across from a glazed-over Ludlow. They’ve all been here b
Point of entry?
Front door on the north side.  15.
Okay. FEMALE D-A. Why didn’t you call for backup?
I did. FEMALE D.A. Why didn’t you wait for backup?
In my opinion, there were exigent circumstances. They had a machine gun and I believed a felony was taking place or about to take place.
Great, great.
I made a point of identifying myself as a police officer. I then attempted to detain the four men when I was shot from the side. FEMALE D.A. Which suspect was that?
Let him finish. Ludlow looks beyond put out.
I returned fire. One of the Charlies-- Everyone stops writing, their heads snapping up.
Excuse me, one of the suspects came out. I hit him...
Ludlow lazily pushes a floor plan sketch back to the D.A.
Great, great.  16.
Do you know what time it is?
Yeah, you’re almost done here. FEMALE D-A. You think Internal Affairs will want--?

Wah, this is all ‘in policy’. Ludlow’s eyes wander, the lawyers’ voices DRONING OUT... INT. MEGAN’S HOME - LATER THAT NIGHT Ludlow’s alive again - in a state of emergency - as Megan tears off his jacket, pushing him on to her bed. He HOWLS Manageable, laughable pain as she tugs at his belt. He squirms away from her, retrieving the jacket... ..-in a pocket he finds a VODKA MINIATURE.
Don’t, you already stink.
You want me to take a shower?

(naughtily) No. Ludlow twists it open, savoring the motion. He tilts the bottle...pouring it down on Megan - a kind of compromise. Megan pulls him to her, letting him drink from the base o her neck. His lapping slows, the sexual energy gone...
What happened tonight Lud?
I can’t tell you.
Fine. You wanna put it all away and pay for it later...
No, I can’t ‘cause I promised an exclusive to that hot bitch on Channel 2.  17.
You’re such a whore. Ludlow laughs, wincing from the pain.
Come on. Give it to me.
I’m trying, you won’t shut up.
It’s not just about the story Lud. If you never talk about anything...you’1l never make it back to the surface. A heavy stillness.
Well let’s help each other. What you want for what I want. Megan gets his meaning, even if we don’t yet.
Okay. Why’d you have to shoot?
They shot me first. Megan obligatorily removes her bra. Then--
Were they all...Vietnamese?
No, there were some white kids but I asked them to leave. She joylessly reaches into his pants. Then--
Why don’t you ever defend yourself?
Because I don’t care if people think I’m a... Whatever they think. Megan straddles Ludlow; she’s on the verge of tears.
Why do you always go alone?  18.
Because if anything goes wrong there’s only my version.
Or you’re dead and gone.
Either way. She begins moving on top of him.
Are you waiting for something to go wrong? Ludlow stares up at Megan...she’s crying now.
Stop. Jesus, stop it. Ludlow moves to the edge of the bed, putting on his pants
(head killing him) Awe Jesus, God, Fuck. (to Megan) You want some water or something?
I’m gonna spin this your way, Lud.
Don’t ever spin anything for me. Okay? Ludlow heads for the door.
I know you’re not this asshole. Halfway out the door, Ludlow turns back in the PRE-DAWN B LIGHT.
Remember how I like you Megan. You’re not my wife. Megan absorbs the blow, her eyes - and temper - welling.
Your wife wasn’t even your wife. Ludlow could go either way; he could leave or he could lo it... He simply shakes his head, turning away.  19.
Where are you going?
(low) Bed.

Outside the front doors, Mody - the crisply-uniformed bla officer - poses for a picture with a YOUNG BOY. Arriving groggily at the entrance, Ludlow is forced to wa several agonizing beats for the boy’s MOTHER to snap the As Mody waves the admiring boy off, Ludlow heads inside--

LUDLOW (cont'd) (leaning away) ‘Suspects’ by the way.

Hats off to Silky!

Keeping up appearances. It’s what I’d do. Ludlow looks around for his waiter. Makes a move to get u

(’How about that?’ ) He’s not gonna touch him. (then) That’s your whole life right there Ludlow. If you ran about two degrees cooler you could’ve been in on some very big things.
Alright, enough. Clady gets the hint, turning away.
We’ve been here before, haven’t we? When the earth opened up on you? I took care of you then; I’m taking care of you now. Now goddamnit just...fall in for once. Ludlow absorbs it all. Then--

You’re an asshole.

(scoffs) Come again?

He puts to his lips, and this time...he DRINKS IT DOWN.  27. Galvanized, Ludlow pulls off his belt. He begins wrapping tightly around his right hand...

Hand tight at his side, Ludlow stalks across the street. pauses for a BROWN MONTE CARLO that rumbles past, pulling next to the Seville. Reaching the front door of the store, Ludlow glances back it’s just a flash - a frozen moment: TWO BLACK MALES - afros and expressionless yellow eyes. Ludlow drifts to a halt a few steps inside. He stands - thunderstruck - as something invades his consciousness... The belt uncoils from his fist, dropping to the floor... He looks back at the Monte Carlo. The driver wasn’t scratching anything; he’s fastening a BULLET-PROOF VEST. The passenger readies a SUB-MACHINE GUN in his lap. Ludlow crouches, drawing his service revolver. He recedes into the store, rounding a corner in a swift run-walk. Down the aisle ahead, Mody shops...
(hisses) Mody. When Mody turns - and sees Ludlow coming at him, service revolver in hand...
Ludlow... He swings his shopping basket, SLAMMING it in Ludlow’s fa like a bag of rocks. Ludlow - caught completely off-guard - goes smacking back into the shelves in an avalanche of dry goods.
Mody...é  28. But Mody is on him before he can rise, pistol-whipping hi with his gun back to the floor.
What the fuck are you doing!? Mody stomps on Ludlow’s gun-hand and jams his .38 service revolver under Ludlow’s cheekbone.
Drop it!
